award_title: REU Site: Next generation plant biology and plant-microbe interactions
subject: Reducing friction around sharing methods
body:
Hi Dr. Nagel,

Running an REU site means a lot of repeated explanations—walking students through protocols, pointing them to scripts, answering the same questions about experimental approaches each summer. Multiply that across 30 students over three years, and it adds up.

Ouro provides a thin API layer over computational workflows, letting other researchers reuse methods directly instead of recreating them from papers. For a program training students in genomics, bioinformatics, and plant-pathogen analysis, it could consolidate what you're already sharing into something more durable and accessible.

I can set up access for your lab if you want to take a glance.

Hope you get some rest over winter break—happy holidays.

Best,

Matt Moderwell
https://ouro.foundation
